items.headline: Dow Soars Above 50,000 for First Time, Broader Market Recovers on Tech Rebound
items.summary: U.S. equities experienced a significant rebound on Friday, February 7, 2026, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average ($DJIA) closing above the historic 50,000 mark for the first time ever. The rally was broad-based, fueled by a resurgence in investor risk appetite and renewed optimism surrounding the U.S. economy, particularly as concerns about AI's business impact softened. While major indices posted strong daily gains, the S&P 500 ($GSPC) and Nasdaq Composite ($IXIC) ended the week lower, indicating underlying volatility and a rotation of capital. Overall market sentiment remains cautious despite Friday's strong performance. Not financial advice.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads Tech Rally
items.summary: Semiconductor giant Nvidia surged amid a powerful rebound in AI hardware.

items.headline: MicroStrategy Jumps with Bitcoin
items.summary: MicroStrategy saw a significant jump as Bitcoin rebounded above $70,000.

items.headline: AMD Continues Upward Momentum
items.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) also posted a strong daily gain.

items.headline: Super Micro Computer Gains
items.summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. showed robust performance.

items.headline: Amazon Slides on AI Spending Plans
items.summary: Amazon's stock fell after the company announced extensive spending plans for new AI and robotics technology, raising investor concerns over near-term returns.

items.headline: Stellantis Plummets on EV Strategy Shift
items.summary: The automaker Stellantis saw a sharp decline following its announcement of a $26 billion business overhaul, primarily linked to scaling back electric vehicle efforts.

items.headline: Molina Healthcare Leads Nasdaq Declines
items.summary: Molina Healthcare plunged, leading decliners on the Nasdaq.

items.headline: Technology and Industrials Led Friday's Sector Gains
items.summary: Nine of the eleven primary S&P 500 sectors closed higher, with Technology (up 4.1%) and Industrials (up 2.84%) leading the rally. The rebound in the semiconductor sector significantly contributed to the positive sentiment.

items.headline: Communication Services and Consumer Discretionary Lagged
items.summary: Conversely, the Communication Services sector declined by 1.51%, and Consumer Discretionary fell by 0.66%, making them the leading laggards for the day.

items.headline: Consumer Sentiment Shows Improvement
items.summary: The University of Michigan's preliminary consumer sentiment index for February rose to 57.3, surpassing economists' expectations of 54.3, indicating a positive shift in consumer confidence.

items.headline: Fed Holds Steady on Rates, Stress Test Scenarios Finalized
items.summary: Fed markets indicate an 86% probability of no change in interest rates for March. The Federal Reserve also finalized scenarios for its 2026 stress tests, outlining potential market volatility and asset price declines.

items.headline: Q4 Earnings Season Continues with Positive Surprises
items.summary: Approximately one-third of S&P 500 companies have reported Q4 2025 earnings, with aggregate results showing earnings 7.6% above estimates. Positive surprises in Communication Services, Health Care, and Financials sectors contributed to the overall earnings growth rate.

items.headline: January Jobs Report Delayed by Government Shutdown
items.summary: The release of the crucial January jobs report has been delayed from February 6 to February 11 due to a partial government shutdown, leaving investors without key economic data.
